description: F-LNG1 Zipf law at n=449 (S345) — METHODOLOGY CORRECTION: switched from stale cache to fresh scan
hypothesis: Lesson citations follow power law with α ≈ 1.0 (Zipf), confirming ISO-8 isomorphism
interpretation: Lesson citation distribution closely follows Zipf's law (α=0.969 ≈ 1.0, R²=0.909). ISO-8 isomorphism CONFIRMED: swarm knowledge corpus exhibits the same scale-free power law as natural language word frequency. A small number of lessons dominate citations (~10 lessons account for most references).
stall_note: Rate comparison invalid: S190-S346 used stale cache, S345 uses fresh scan. Prior series measured cache staleness, not real α change.

methodology_correction.bug_found: compact-citation-cache.json 100% stale (all 609 file SHAs mismatched). compact.py regex L-(\d+) also had PHIL-N phantom edge bug (L-510 category). F-LNG1 read stale cache for all S190-S346 measurements.
fix_applied: f_lng1_zipf_lessons.py switched from cache to direct scan
methodology_correction.impact: Prior series S190(0.9)→S346(0.734) was artifact of increasing cache staleness, not real distributional shift. Corrected α=0.9689 restores ZIPF_STRONG verdict.
methodology_correction.prior_series_status: S190 may have used fresh scan (valid). S301-S346 increasingly biased by stale cache. All prior points should be treated as UNRELIABLE until re-measured with corrected tool.
